result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: as carrier gas.To confirm that the product was due to the photoreduction (i.e., CO 2 was the only carbon source and the catalyst was involved in the photochemical reaction), three control experiments were carried out under exactly the same conditions except (1) under dark condition, (2) without catalysts, and (3) with N 2 instead of CO 2 .No any products were detected in these control experiments, suggesting that the observed product was from the photoreduction of CO 2 owing to the catalytic effect.In

(SEM, Hitachi S4800) equipped with energy dispersive X-ray spectrometer (EDS).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images and high resolution TEM (HRTEM) images were carried out with 200 kV (Tecnai G2 20 s-TWIN).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS, ESCALAB 250Xi) was used to determine the composition and the valence band maximum of the as-prepared catalysts.UV-visible diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) were collected on a Lambda 750 UVvisibleNIR spectrophotometer. can be probed.As shown in Table 1, no any organic molecules can be detected for the blank experiments using N 2 instead of CO 2 , indicating no original carbohydrate or other carbon residue present in the reaction system.As no any products can be observed without irradiation, in addition, the reaction is triggered by the photons.Furthermore, no CH 4 is observed without the utilization of catalyst, suggesting that the catalyst serves as a bridge between the CO 2 transformation and photons.Since STO does not

inlet was kept clean, i.e., no contaminants of previous samples or air.Moreover, CO 2 was saturated in the water and adsorbed on the catalyst surface to achieve equilibrium between adsorption and desorption.The system was irradiated by visible light (l 420 nm) from a xenon lamp (300 W).The reaction was kept for 10 h and the product was analyzed every one hour by a GC (Agilent 7890) with one thermal conductivity detector (TCD) and two flame ionization detectors (FID), using helium as carrier gas.To confirm

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX
